findings.title: Improved Input Validation of deposit()
findings.description: In the Mushrooms protocol, the user is allowed to deposit either stablecoin (e.g., USDC) or exposure token (e.g., BTC). For example, the user deposits 1000 USDC, then the protocol will swap half value of the deposit, which is 500 USDC for BTC, to keep the value of USDC and BTC owned by the user equal.

findings.title: Mushmon Token Idiosyncrasies
findings.description: The difference on the calculation of the share for the user makes its share token different as well.

findings.title: Trust Issue Of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the MushMons protocol, there is a special administrative account, i.e., governance, which plays a critical role in governing and regulating the protocol-wide operations.

findings.title: Proper Minimum Balance Enforcement
findings.description: The current implementation of the withdraw function in the MushMons contract does not properly honor the minimum balance requirement, using a stale balance instead of retrieving the actual balance.
